spread_model.name: Spread Model
spread_model.description: Uses the variation in hourly temperature forecasts to estimate uncertainty. This is our original and most tested model.

how_it_works.step_1: We take all 24 hourly temperature forecasts from Zeus and find the maximum - this becomes our expected daily high temperature (μ).
how_it_works.step_2: We calculate how much the hourly temperatures vary (standard deviation) and multiply by √2 to account for the fact that daily highs have more uncertainty than individual hourly readings.
how_it_works.step_3: We use a normal distribution (bell curve) centered at our expected high, with the calculated uncertainty, to estimate the probability that the actual daily high falls into each temperature bracket.
how_it_works.step_4: The probabilities are normalized so they add up to 100% across all brackets.

spread_model.when_to_use: This is our default model. Use it when you want a proven, conservative approach that works well with the current Zeus API data.

sigma_default.description: Default uncertainty when we can't calculate from spread

sigma_min.description: Minimum uncertainty to prevent extreme predictions

sigma_max.description: Maximum uncertainty to prevent overly wide distributions

bands_model.name: Bands Model
bands_model.description: Uses Zeus confidence intervals (likely and possible ranges) to estimate uncertainty. More theoretically grounded but requires Zeus API enhancements.

how_it_works.step_1: We take the peak temperature from Zeus forecasts as our expected daily high (μ).
how_it_works.step_2: If Zeus provides confidence bands (likely ≈80% and possible ≈95% ranges), we use these to calculate uncertainty (σ). We solve: σ = (upper_bound - mean) / z_score, where z_score is based on the confidence level.
how_it_works.step_3: We average the uncertainty estimates from both confidence levels to get a final σ value.
how_it_works.step_4: We use a normal distribution with this σ to calculate bracket probabilities, just like the spread model.
how_it_works.fallback: Currently, Zeus API doesn't provide confidence bands, so this model falls back to the spread calculation method.

bands_model.when_to_use: Use this model when Zeus API starts providing confidence bands. It should provide better calibrated uncertainty estimates than the spread model.

edge_calculation.description: We calculate edge as the difference between our Zeus probability and the market probability, minus fees and slippage.

minimum_edge.description: We only trade when edge is at least 5%

position_sizing.description: We use the Kelly Criterion to determine how much to bet on each opportunity, with multiple safety caps.
position_sizing.kelly_formula: f* = (b×p - q) / b, where b = (1/price - 1), p = our probability, q = 1 - p

kelly_cap.description: Maximum Kelly fraction per trade (10% of bankroll)

minimum_liquidity.description: We only trade markets with at least $1000 of available liquidity

liquidity_requirements.description: We check market depth to ensure we can enter and exit positions without significant slippage.
